Explanation: A use statement for the Button object. A button is a selectable user interface component.
Creates a button object on the form
A use statement for the BehaviorEvent object. A BehaviorEvent is sent to you when a button is clicked.
A use statement for the FormBehavior object. FormBehavior is a special class for handling events.
This action is the heart of a Behavior. It will run if a Button is clicked with this Behavior attached to it.
Returns a Form object representing the form in the app.
Returns a Page object representing the current page of the app.
Identifies the element (perhaps a button) that triggered a Behavior.
Attaches a behavior to a button. When the button is clicked, the behavior runs.
Retrieves the specific button name from the button click in order to perform a specific action
